text: Kent Lon Wakeford (January 23, 1928 â€“ October 10, 2020) was an American cinematographer and television commercial producer. Wakeford was best known for working on Martin Scorsese's movies Mean Streets and Alice Doesn't Live Here Anymore, as well as on the movies Some Folks Call It a Sling Blade and Wedding Bell Blues. Wakeford died at a retirement home in Calabasas, California on October 10, 2020, at the age of 92.Kent Lon Wakeford, Martin Scorsese DP, Dies at 92 ==References== Category:1928 births Category:2020 deaths Category:American cinematographers Category:American television producers Category:Businesspeople from Los Angeles Category:Military people from California Category:Movie directors from Los Angeles
title: Kent L. Wakeford
